pullrequest.title: Workaround for ign-cmake issue with ign-transport5

content.raw:
> I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

Will a target that links against `ignition-cmake1` use everything that `ignition-cmake1` provides except the `utilities` package?

> currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

Yeah, I think they are the same.  

> Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround

This was my concern. For now, this works as you said, but if you release a new version of ignition-cmake where the utilities package is totally different, we could have a potential problem. As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.
content.html:
I'm not sure what you mean. Can you rephrase the question?

Will a target that links against ignition-cmake1 use everything that ignition-cmake1 provides except the utilities package?

currently the ign-cmake utilities component just has a SuppressWarning.hh header file, which I don't think has changed between version 1 and 2

Yeah, I think they are the same.

Ideally we should fix ign-cmake so it doesn't get the wrong version, but in the meantime, I think this is a valid workaround

This was my concern. For now, this works as you said, but if you release a new version of ignition-cmake where the utilities package is totally different, we could have a potential problem. As long as this is tracked somewhere, I'm completely fine with it.
